articles.title: The Violinist Who Fell in Love With Machine Learning
articles.summary: Music and engineering might seem like career paths that are almost diametrically opposed. articles.title: Reviving a 1970s Analog HP X-Y Recorder

articles.title: Digital Signal Processing Pioneer Jim Boddie Remembered
articles.summary: James R. “Jim” Boddie, a pioneer of the programmable, single-chip digital signal processor, died on 2 December at his home in Canton, Ga., following a long illness. articles.title: Cuba’s Power Grid Nears Total Failure
articles.summary: For many Cubans, the sudden stop of a fan is more than just an annoyance on a tropical island; it’s a daily reminder of a critical, nationwide problem. articles.title: Large Language Models Are Improving Exponentially
articles.summary: Benchmarking large language models presents some unusual challenges. articles.title: LLM Benchmarking Shows Capabilities Doubling Every 7 Months
